item.title: VMware VIEW 4 useful information
item.description: After attending the VMware View 4 Talkshoe podcast the following information about the announced VMware View 4 was discussed: VM’s per core: VM’s per core, In VMware View 3 the number was 6-9 VM’s per core, now in View 4 with for example the Intel Nehalem processors you can get to 12-16 VM’s per core. This number heavily depends for example on the application load inside the VM’s. The PCoIP protocol does NOT support: Security Server; Smart Cards integration; Thinprint support.
